titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peggy DeMichele Papers 1939-1986
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kristin Gates

publicationstmt.publisher: Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana--Missoula

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Donna McCrea 2021
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard) 2nd edition.

repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: This collection contains personal ephemera and photographs belonging to Peggy DeMichele, long-standing Administrative Aide to Montana politician Mike Mansfield. It also contains photos, speeches, and documents of Montana Congressman James O'Connor, with whom DeMichele worked prior to Mansfield.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Margaret (Peggy) Connelly was born on March 3, 1921 in Denver, Colorado and began working as a secretary to U.S. Representative James O'Connor of Montana in 1940. When O'Connor died in office in 1945, Mike Mansfield, then a freshman Congressman, asked Peggy to work in his office. After Mansfield was elected to the U.S. Senate, he appointed Peggy as his Administrative Aide in 1953. At the time, she was one of only three women to hold a top Senate staff appointment. She stayed in the position until Mansfield retired in 1977. Peggy married Joseph DeMichele (1929-1990) in 1946 and died on July 3, 2001.

scopecontent.p: The Peggy DeMichele papers contain photos, speeches, and documents of Montana Congressman James O’Connor, with whom DeMichele worked prior to Mike Mansfield, as well as her personal ephemera and photos.

arrangement.p: this collection has been arranged chronologically.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Non-exclusive copyright held by the University of Montana.

prefercite.p: Peggy DeMichele Papers, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: This collection was held by Sheila Mansfield Miller, DeMichele's niece by marriage, prior to donation to Archives and Special Collection.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
controlaccess.corpname: aUnited States. Congress. Senate--Officials and employees
aUnited States. Congress. House--Officials and employees

did.unittitle: US Representative James O'Connor clippings, speeches, and photos

note.p: Congressional remarks about his work on the Committee of Indian Affairs; keynote speech delivered at the Montana State Democratic Convention; photo of O'Connor and Burton K. Wheeler and other photos of O'Connor; death announcements
Peggy DeMichele's Congressional employee identification cards; tribute broadcast to DeMichele from Eye on the Hill's Joseph McCaffrey upon her retirement in 1976
Photos of Peggy DeMichele and other aides in Mansfield's Senate office; signed photo from Mike Mansfield from Tokyo

did.unittitle: Peggy DeMichele collection of tributes to Joe Meglen

note.p: Tributes to Montana attorney and Democratic supporter Joseph Meglen; telegrams of condolence from Mike and Maureen Mansfield, Max Baucus, and others; eulogy delivered by Senator John Melcher; copy of memorial service read in court at the Yellowstone County Bar Association; letter to Peggy DeMichele from the Meglen family
